content: I'd like to work on const eval, but I have no idea of where to start, does anyone know where I can see some available work/ressources to look into to see what to do there ? Thanks!

we do have the label on github, but that's a very arbitrary list without any clear markers for whether something can be worked on: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AA-const-eval
I'm just about to leave, so if I'm not posting more info tomorrow, just ping me again
@traxys What do you already know so far?

There is this skill tree if you have not found it yet. https://rust-lang.github.io/const-eval/
which might help you make sense of the overall structure of the project.
Can you explain how to read the skill tree?
Basically features to the right need features to the left as indicated by arrows to be implemented first.

I know a small bit about the rust compiler, I implemented a query some time ago. I read the Rustc book on Lowering and MIR and such, though I have not used the concepts.
I did not have time this week to check the links, I'll do that this week end

Hameer Abbasi said:

And what's the person raising hand?

https://github.com/nikomatsakis/skill-tree/blob/d486693b750bacd7fa58ad1743e2f8c6bcba6cee/src/graphviz.rs#L135

It represents Status::Unassigned
